title: 110_s889
content: The "Deepwater Accountability Act" is the short title of the Act. It aims to improve the acquisition process under the Deepwater program of the Coast Guard. The Secretary of Homeland Security must acquire all assets under the current contract with Integrated Coast Guard Systems through new contracts solicited under full and open competition requirements. The use of a lead systems integrator is prohibited for this acquisition. The Secretary may enter into a new contract with Integrated Coast Guard Systems for assets under construction if it poses a national security risk or exceeds costs with other contractors. The Secretary may enter into a new contract with Integrated Coast Guard Systems for assets under construction if it poses a national security risk or exceeds costs with other contractors. If the Secretary determines to acquire assets under a contract with Integrated Coast Guard Systems, reports to Congress on the construction status must be submitted every 180 days. Additionally, a report on the proposed acquisition must be submitted to Congress within 30 days of the enactment of this Act. The Secretary must submit a report to Congress on the acquisition of assets under the Deepwater program, listing incomplete assets and those proposed for acquisition. The Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security must also review the Deepwater program within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Secretary must report to Congress on Deepwater program asset acquisition, including incomplete and proposed assets. The Inspector General of the Department of Homeland Security will assess decisions leading to cost overruns, violations of contract terms, and responsibility for increased program costs. Coast Guard Systems is responsible for covering any cost overruns related to decisions made. Definitions include "asset" as products acquired under the Deepwater program contract, and "Integrated Coast Guard Systems" as the joint venture between Lockheed Martin Corporation and Northrop Grumman Corporation for delivering assets to the Coast Guard.
